Ein Parcours durch die Arenenberger Viel: A journey through the diversity of Arenenberg
Willkommen im Arenenberger Milchviehstal: Welcome to the Arenenberg dairy barn!
Du begleitest die Kuh Frida durch einen: Accompany Frida the Cow on a typical April day and learn about the work done in the Arenenberg dairy barn. Choose a character and click the time of day that interests you on the time line! You’ll learn useful information about the staff’s duties in the barn and about the animals at Arenenberg. Then, you can take a quiz to test your knowledge! Have fun!
Danke fürs Mitmachen! Du kennst dich jet: Thank you for taking the quiz! You know your way around the Arenenberg dairy barn really well now.
Folgen Sie einem typischen Apriltag eine: Follow a typical April day of a cow in the Arenenberg dairy cowshed! Frida is a five-year-old dairy cow. She has calved twice and provides an average of 25 litres of milk per day.
Frida geht auf die Weide. Sie frisst jun: Frida goes to the pasture. She eats fresh, green grass. This is very nutritious fodder.
Frida und die anderen Kühe am Arenenberg: Frida and the other cows at Arenenberg have a considerable amount of freedom. They decide for themselves when to eat and drink, when to lie down and when to be milked.
Frida geht zurück zum Stall. Sie freut s: Frida returns to her cowshed. She is looking forward to her next course, i.e. the bait pellets waiting for her by the milking robot.
Die Kühe sollen möglichst viel junges Gr: The cows should eat as much fresh grass as possible on the pasture, but not all day long. They need to be milked at least twice per day. The cows can graze down a pasture of this size within a few hours. They return to the cowshed before noon for milking in the knowledge that they will be allowed back onto a fresh, new pasture in the afternoon.
Frida steht im Melkroboter. Sie frisst l: Frida is standing by the milking robot. She eats delicious fodder and is being milked. The milking robot always milks the cows in the same, patient way. Frida finds it a pleasant experience.
Die Kühe werden mit Futter in den Melkro: The cows are enticed into the milking robot with fodder. They are milked by an automatic milking system. It's stress-free and does not take very long. The cows need to be milked at least twice per day.
Besonders nach dem Melken, aber auch imm: Frida drinks fresh water from the trough, especially after milking but also in between, averaging about 120 litres per day. After eating the fresh, green grass, Frida would like something dry and high in fibre. She eats hay at the feed alley. Hay is an ideal complement to young grass, and stabilises Frida's digestion.
Der Melkroboter und ein Sensor am Halsba: The milking robot and a sensor on the cow’s collar collect information about the milk and the cow, for example, about the quality of the milk or the cows' activity. It also provides information about the cow's health.
Frida will sich ausruhen und legt sich i: Frida wants to rest and lies down in the freshly sprinkled sawdust. Beforehand, she carries out her personal hygiene routine and lets the automatic livestock brush remove the dust from her hide.
Der Kompostierungsstall bietet den Kühen: The composting barn provides the cows with plenty of comfortable material to lie on and plenty of freedom to move about. The floor is covered with fresh bedding material such as sawdust. The bedding material, dung and urine of the cows produce a rich compost, which is then spread on the fields as fertiliser.
Es ist Zeit, nochmals auf die Weide zu g: It’s time to go grazing again. Frida goes to the pasture gate and is allowed onto a new, fresh pasture with lush grass.
Die Kühe werden über das Weidetor gesteu: The cows are controlled via the pasture gate. The pasture gate only lets them onto the pasture if they were last milked less than seven hours ago. Otherwise, they are led back to the cowshed for milking before they are released.
Satt gefressen begibt sich Frida zurück: Her hunger stilled, Frida returns to the cowshed and is milked again. She then chooses whether to spend the night in the cowshed or outdoors on the pasture.
